subject: Communication
title: The Role of Identity in Conflict
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Role of Identity in Conflict usable.

hook.text: A simple correction at work triggers an explosive reaction. The feedback was minor. The rage was enormous. Why?

buildup.text: Douglas Stone's research found that the most intense conflicts threaten our core identity: Am I competent? Am I good?

discovery.text: When feedback challenges our self-image, our brain treats it as an existential threat â€” triggering fight-or-flight.

twist.text: This explains why small criticisms cause big reactions. The issue isn't the feedback â€” it's the identity story it.

climax.text: Effective conflict resolution requires making it safe for identities.

punchline.text: The fiercest conflicts aren't about issues. They're about who we believe we are.

quiz.question: Why do small criticisms sometimes trigger huge reactions?
